definition: to neglect/to skip (class or work)/to waste (time)/vast/loose-fitting

sentences.english: The spaciousness and gloom of this vast edifice produce a profound and mysterious awe.
sentences.chinese: 这座大寺空旷幽暗，使人产生深沉而神秘的敬畏之念。

sentences.english: Campers at inland sea in empty quarter.
sentences.chinese: 内海畔，一片空旷区域里的露营者。

sentences.english: Sky gradually dim, empty river Piaoqi the thick strands of rain drift.
sentences.chinese: 天色渐渐暗淡，空旷的河面飘起了密密的雨丝。

sentences.english: The flat land gave the soldiers no cover from enemy fire.
sentences.chinese: 空旷地使军队无法躲避敌人的炮火。

sentences.english: Thoughts may go exotic night souls, in the open on the Makino erratic.
sentences.chinese: 思绪似异域夜走的魂灵，在空旷的牧野上飘忽不定。

sentences.english: And the ancient empty street's too dead for dreaming.
sentences.chinese: 而这空旷旧街的死寂，又叫人不能入眠。

sentences.english: The people of Concep-cion rushed into the streets and open places.
sentences.chinese: 康塞普西翁的人们用上街头和跑到空旷的地方。

sentences.english: If you are outside get into the open away from buildings and power lines.
sentences.chinese: 如果在室外，找到空旷地带，远离建筑物和电线电缆。

sentences.english: His voice echoed in the vast, empty room.
sentences.chinese: 他的声音在空旷的房间中回荡。

sentences.english: He went to an open wild and dug himself a grave.
sentences.chinese: 他来到一片空旷的野地里，给自己挖了一个坟。

sentences.english: It can fester in those wide open spaces for thousands of years.
sentences.chinese: 那东西在那些空旷了千百年的地方会化脓烂掉。

sentences.english: Don't take short-cuts through empty buildings or parking lots.
sentences.chinese: 不要从空旷的大楼或停车场那里抄近路。

sentences.english: The beauty of outdoors is very important to you and me now-a-days.
sentences.chinese: 空旷之美，对于今天的我和你，实在太重要了。

sentences.english: All people, empty hall resounded with, he and her love.
sentences.chinese: 所有人散去，空旷的大厅，回荡着的是他和她的爱情。

sentences.english: C. It's a spacious and silent road, and you can make your thoughts whirl around.
sentences.chinese: 空旷的大道上寂静无声，任你思绪飞扬。

definition: left to return to unchecked growth/overgrown/grown wild
no sign of human habitation (idiom); desolate
